borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">The&nbsp;design and siting of the proposed side extension will result in unacceptable levels of overlooking, detrimental to the privacy of 152 Wood Lane,&nbsp;therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:-</span></p><ul><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework (2021); -</span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies D1, D4 and&nbsp;D8&nbsp; of the London Plan (March 2021); -</span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BP8&nbsp;of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); -</span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); -</span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies DMD1, DMD6 the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation version, October 2020).</span></li></ul>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">The single storey side extension for reasons of design, mass, bulk and sitting will appear disproportionately&nbsp;large and at odds with the character and appearance&nbsp;of the street scene, property, terrace row and the surrounding local area. This impact is notable given the sites location within the Becontree Estate. The proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to:-</span></p><ul><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework (2021); -</span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies D1, D4, D8 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies CP2 and&nbsp;CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies BP2 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies SP2, SP4, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation version, October 2020).</span></li></ul>
description: Retrospective application for single storey side extension with proposed amendments to demolish the front wall of toilet, alter size with pitch roof to suite the house and reduction in fence height.
